title: Un jardin sur l'Oronte (opera)
text:
Un jardin sur l'Oronte ("A Garden on the Orontes") is an <a href="opera">opera</a> ("<a href="lyric%20drama">lyric drama</a>") in four acts and eight tableaux by <a href="Alfred%20Bachelet">Alfred Bachelet</a> to a French <a href="libretto">libretto</a> adapted by <a href="Franc-Nohain">Franc-Nohain</a> from a <a href="Un%20jardin%20sur%20l%27Oronte">novel of the same name</a> by <a href="Maurice%20Barr%C3%A8s">Maurice Barrès</a>. The premiere took place on 7 November 1932 at the <a href="Palais%20Garnier">Palais Garnier</a> in Paris, France.
Performance history.
"Un jardin sur l'Oronte" was premiered at the <a href="Palais%20Garnier">Palais Garnier</a> in Paris on 7 November 1932 with <a href="Suzanne%20Balguerie">Suzanne Balguerie</a> in the title role. It was conducted by <a href="Philippe%20Gaubert">Philippe Gaubert</a>, with sets and costumes designed by and executed by Mouveau, Solatgès and Mathieu, and a choreography by <a href="L%C3%A9o%20Staats">Léo Staats</a>.
